body: Why would you need to change that?
We are making some changes to our dev environment and need the log filename to be static.

@BrandonNoad That doesn't really answer my question. What do you mean by static?

@shahrushabh1996 Please don't suggest manual edits of the stock framework code. And especially not here - this is our official repository, not a random forum board for people who want quick hacks.

Instead of having a new log file each day, we want to have a single log file, which is actually a symlink that points to /dev/stderr. 

Ideally, we could log directly to stderr. But I don't think that is possible, so this is a workaround.

I have to say, I don't think that's a particularly good idea.

To be honest, when I asked why you'd need the feature I expected you to say something like per-vhost logfiles. And I've slowly convinced myself that we do need such a feature, so this does go into the TODO list.

Thanks.

We are moving our project to Kubernetes/Docker, and this feature will help with that.

Cheers.

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

body:
@narfbg I might have a crack at this, what do you propose to do with $config['log_file_extension'] to avoid it not adding to $filepath making it FALSE? and checking against it, if its not then adding .php?

Or are you still wanting it to always have an extension and letting him do the symlink thing?

[issue-#5648.patch.txt](https://github.com/bcit-ci/CodeIgniter/files/2802907/issue-.5648.patch.txt)

@narfbg Right, did it properly this time. Would I be able to push these changes myself or is that restricted?

issue.title: fixes #5648

issue.body: Signed-off-by: jonsmith1982  - Sorry, I sent a patch to fix this in the original post. Just getting used to git and how best to do things.

body: We were able to redirect the CodeIgniter logs to container's STDOUT by modifying CodeIgniter logging module which is located at system/core/Log.php, here is the full tutorial just in-case if anyone looking for a solution: https://shyamjos.com/redirecting-codeigniter-logs-to-container-stdout-stderr/

> We were able to redirect the CodeIgniter logs to container's STDOUT by modifying CodeIgniter logging module which is located at system/core/Log.php, here is the full tutorial just in-case if anyone looking for a solution: https://shyamjos.com/post/redirecting-codeigniter-logs-to-container-stdout-stderr/

For those coming here late on like myself - that link has changed to https://shyamjos.com/redirecting-codeigniter-logs-to-container-stdout-stderr/
